groups

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

logentry_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

password

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

user_permissions

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

username

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

user_auth.urls module

user_auth.views module

user_auth.views.authenticate_user(request)[source]

Authenticate a user and logs them in if the credential are valid

Parameters:

request – HttpRequest containing Post data with username and password.

Returns:

HttpResponseRedirect to show_user view if authentication is successful. HttpResponseRedirect to user_login view if authentication fails

user_auth.views.register(request)[source]

Renders the registration page

Parameters:

request – Httprequest object.

Returns:

HttpResponse object rendering the registration template.

user_auth.views.show_user(request)[source]

Displays the username of the logged-in user

Parameters:

request – HttpRequest object.

Returns:

HttpResponse object rendering the user template with the username context.

user_auth.views.signup(request)[source]

Handles user signup process. If the request method is POST and the form is valid, saves the user and log them in. Otherwise render the signup form.

Parameters:

request – HttpRequest object containing POST data with signup details.

Returns:

HttpResponseRedirect ro band:home if signup is successful. httpResponseRedirect object rendering the registration template with the form.

user_auth.views.user_login(request)[source]

Renders the login page

Param request:

HttpRequest object

Returns:

HttpResponse object rendering the login template.
